Na początku bałem się, że po przejściu jedynki, dwójka mnie zanudzi, bo... Bo w sumie co można jeszcze wymyślić do tego rodzaju gry?
Na początku zastanawiałem się zaś czy to na pewno wciąż portal. Później, kiedy okazało się, że jak najbardziej, znowu myślałem, że będę robić to, co w jedynce. Na szczęście okazało się, że ta część posiada całkiem niezłą fabułę, dialogi i zwroty akcji. Ostatecznie się nie zawiodłem. Chyba, ze na własnych zdolnościach - zastanawiałem się dziesięć minut nad zagadką, której rozwiązanie było oczywiste :)

игра класс я всю прошол

Fiquei encantado ao terminar portal. O jogo é relativamente curto, levando em desconsideração os mapas bonus... Mas ainda é um dinheiro bem gasto. A jogabilidade é no minimo inovadora, a história é simples porém otima... E a GlaDOS é sem sombra de duvidas, uma das melhores vilãs que já vi. 

Honestamente, eu esperava muita coisa da sequência... E não fiquei desapontado. 

Portal 2 é sem a menor sombra de duvidas, um dos melhores jogos que já joguei em toda minha vida. A história é infinitamente melhor, as personagens e suas aparições (da mais simples a mais fundamental) são perfeitas (destaque pro "adventure core" e seu "explosion day")! E até mesmo a jogabilidade deu um salto (literalmente), as novas mecânicas são extremamente simples e criativas. 

Isso por que nem joguei o modo cooperativo, ou testei uma "community chamber" ainda. Enfim, eu super recomendo!

[h1] Pequeñas Reviews de NerdastiK [/h1]

[b] Portal 2 [/b]

De los creadores de Half-Life, TF2, Left 4 Dead y CSGO, les presento una pieza maestra en el mundo del gaming, uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en mi vida, Portal 2.

Portal 2 es un juego que salio en 2011, creado por Valve, en el que jugamos como "Chell" una mujer intentando escapar de Aperture Science, una faciilidad cientifica controlada por GlaDOS una IA letal.

No voy a spoilear mucho de la historia, al igual que en las demas reviews, voy a ir a que me gusta, que no y mi opinion del juego.

El juego se caracteriza por los portales y las fisicas obviamente, lo cual lo hace un juego excelente de la manera que esto es ejecutado, la historia es hermosa y la cantidad de mapas de la comunidad hacen que este juego sea INTERMINABLE.

He jugado a este juego desde que salio en 2011 en la version NOSTEAM y me encanto desde que lo vi al igual que Portal en 2007, lo aprendi, lo "speedrunee" y lo mejor lo disfrute! Este juego es digno de ser jugado por cualquier persona, sin depender de edad o gusto por los FPS.

Pequeña review pero descriptiva! Aca las puntuaciones:

[u] Sonido: [/u] 9
[u] Graficos: [/u] 9
[u] Historia: [/u] 10
[u] Jugabilidad: [/u] 10
[u] Inmersion / Rejugabilidad: [/u] 10

[b] Puntuacion Total: 9.6 | MASTERPIECE / Must play [/b]

The best game that I have ever played. So well designed, delicate, surprising story, character development... everything. And I thought to myself that Portal was excell, I cannot find the appropriate word for Portal 2. I love how GLaDOS changed in this game :) I would recommend the game to anyone who claims himself is a gamer. If you haven't played Portal 2 yet, you are still missing something...

Portal 2 expands further into the events that transpired at Aperature Science Laboratories and we discover what has happened to the test subject, Chell. As you progress, you encounter a British speaking personality core named Weatley who wants to help you escape the facility once again and defeat GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) once and for all. However, things don't go quite as planned...

As such, a new adventure begins to unfold, filled with mystery, humor, and new physics! Aperature Science has been hold out on all of us. With new Propulsion gel and Repulsion Gel, players will get to use portals in brand-new combinations unlike anything they've ever seen before.

When I first played "Portal," and prepared to play "Portal 2," I wondered how they were going to take such a simple game and find a way to top it in the sequel. But I found that "Portal 2" didn't just do better than the first game, it exceeded it. It maintained what made the first game work in the first place, and added some new features and more story to make it even more of a fun ride. And it really manages to maintain the quality standards that were set by the first "Portal."

Once again, this game uses the Source Engine, just as the original did. And given how this engine has aged very well, it works very well in this context. The graphics are still very gorgeous. You are again in the Aperture Science Labs, albeit, ones that have seen better days. Once again, this environment feels very fresh, while at the same time, familiar to returning players who've played the first game. The Old Aperture areas are a very nice addition to the game, with their style aesthetics from each section's respective time. 

The gameplay is unchanged from the original game, and the game's challenges are equally as challenging and engaging as the original game. But I'm glad the game has some additions to the gameplay, such as being able to see which portal is where, so you can more easily keep track of which portal you've used in one location, and you can use the other one in the proper manner. The tests aren't hard if you're smart, but at the same time, they've added some new challenges, such as using the gels. The gels can be fun to use (my favorites are the acceleration and repulsion gels) and they add new dimensions to the gameplay in tandem with the portals.

The voice acting once again shines in this game. Ellen McLain outdoes herself as GLaDOS in this game, while Stephen Merchant as Wheatley really steals the show at times. Wheatley is such a lovable idiot, you really look forward to every moment he appears. GLaDOS still manages to be funny as well, especially when [spoiler] she is forced to be powered by a potato battery and has to spend a large portion of the game attached to the Portal Gun [/spoiler]. But then there's Cave Johnson, voiced by J.K. Simmons, who really steals the show during the Old Aperture section. Johnson is such a colorful joy to listen to. The game's voice acting does a great job of not taking this game too seriously, it makes you want to come back just to listen to it. And even the turrets are still funny.

The game maintains the immersive nature that the first game had. It lets the game unfold before you as it did in the original. This of course, made the plot less predictable. It worked in the first game, and it works in this game. And I liked how they were able to make this game twice as long as the original was.

I have fewer complaints about this game than the first one. This game reduced the dependency on using Portals to make some of the jumps. Of course, it's still present, but it's not as big a deal as in the first one. Also, at times, it can be a bit easy to get lost in some of the Old Aperture sections. 

This game was a good ride and definitely worth revisiting in the future. It's still a game you want to come back to and try again. Again, you'll think up new ways to solve all the tests, and the learning curve is simple enough for first-time players, and there's enough challenge for experienced ones. This game has improved greatly on the original in that respect to challenge. The voice acting makes the game more fun to enjoy, and overall, the game avoids changing it's formula too much so that it still feels like the game it started off as. When a sequel is able to outperform the original, you know it's doing something right. I will be playing this again.

Edit: And yes, "Funniest A.I. Characters" is a legit reason why I would award this. GLaDOS and Wheatley....priceless.

Portal 2 is not a first person shooter as some of the other reviews might suggest.  The game is simply a puzzle game - simply and beautifully a puzzle - the likes of which I have not seen in over two decades.

Equiped with a portal gun that lets you "teleport," you must interact with your environment to progress through each puzzle.  Although I found each puzzle is challenging in it's own respect, I was never frustrated with the puzzles.

The game comes with an entertaining singleplayer mode that has a story, and endless more fun via custom levels built by others through the workshop.  I repeat, I have not seen a puzzle game of this caliber in many years.  Thank you, developers, for this gem!

I loved this game. Portal 2 is a very quiet game with some very challenging levels, along the way you will find one particular friend, a very nice friend. During the games you will slowly realise what you have done to GLaDOS, and what that has done to the facility of Apeture Science. Trying to finish the levels that are left to get you way out of there. But then you are torn to one or another side, causing the game to change completly. Some other options in this game are multiplayer, Multiplayer is a very fun way to explore the apeture science levels with a guiding hand. And the online Steam communites lets you create or play other or your levels.

Hello
传送门2，神作，更是steam好评率最高的游戏，以前盗版第一次通关，简直是神一样的体验，现在买了正版却没有动力通关第二遍，连IGN也说除非你想再次重温一遍剧情，否则不会有太多的动力去玩第二遍，因为第一次就是永恒。

Portal 2 is alike the first Portal game retaining all the mechanics and aspects of the game you already liked and adds more content into every single possible aspect. More levels, more story, more humour, more puzzle mechanics, more atmosphere, more achievements and more campaign modes to play in (AKA the new co-op mode). The singeplayer campaign is a blast to go through with the intriguing story, witty dialogue and puzzles that are tons of fun and the co-op is just as fun as you use the things you learnt in singeplayer for co-op but expanding on much more possibilites on level design with the use of four portals as apposed to two. What I love about this game so much is how even when I'm stuck in the game I still have fun using my brain to figure the level out and there's no other game that comes to mind that is so consistently fun even in situations when confused on what to do. If you do not have this game I really, really, really, really, really recommend for you to get it. It is not only my favourite game in my Steam library but possibly my absolute favourite game of all time. I usually don't give number scores to games but this game would definitely be worthy of a 10/10.
A graphically intense puzzle game. Get your brain gears turning to solve intense puzzles while fighting for your freedom. Play with the sound on because the story is magnificent and hilarious.
god game

Este juego es muy entretenido y es uno de mis favoritos. La historia es lineal, ya que consiste en pruebas secuenciales según el trazado o nivel que se esté. Cada cámara de prueba está perfectamente realizada y no hallé ningún error en éstas. La sensación mientras se juega es sorprendente; tratar de salir y conseguir la puerta deslizadora de salida, por ejemplo, es una sensación de éxito jaja. 

El modo cooperativo ni hablar... Jugarlo en modo coop y compartir ideas o preposiciones durante las pruebas para superar los obstáculos es realmente jocoso y divertido. Además, hay contenido gratis elaborado por la comunidad y que son geniales. 

Portal 2 es un juego que aprovecha totalmente las neuronas.

10/10

This is how a sequel is done. A perfect sequel. A little bit harder then portal 1 and thats a good thing. Solid music, a good story, brilliant atmospheric, a very great platformer/puzzle game with humour. And just long enough too. I (for once) can`t find any cons on this game.

I will also like to add that playing this with a friend coop ,both the story and mods is fantastic. This is probably one of my favourite games ever regardless of platform and genre
